lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIn jl mIn giq suKmnw sMgm huie aulit pvn kY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Livaleen Jal Meen Gati , Soukhamanaa Sangam Hui Ulati Pavan Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a fish swims through towards upstream swiftly, so does a disciple of Guru engrossed in the Guru's word crosses the confluence of all the three veins (Irha, Pingla and Sukhmana) with the methodology of reverse breathing/air.

lines.gurmukhi: ibsm ibs√çws ibKY AnBY AiBAws rs pRym mDu ApIau pIAY guhju gvn kY
lines.transliteration_english: Bisam Bisvaas Bikhai Anabhai Abhiaas Rasa , Praym Madhu Apeeu Peeai Guhaju Gavan Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming fearless in the strange devotion and love, engrossed in the practice of Naam Simran and reaching there through strangely mysterious ways, one drinks deep the loving eternal nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd kY Anhd suriq kY aunmnI pRym kY inJr Dwr shj rvn kY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Kai Anahad Surati Kai Ounamanee , Praym Kai Nijhar Dhaar Sahaj Ravan Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By plentiful practicing of meditation on Guru's teachings, the mind starts listening to the unstruck melody. As a result, it changes its stance and becomes God-oriented. Then one relishes the continuous flow of the divine nectar that is produced as a resu

lines.gurmukhi: qiRkutI aulMiG suK swgr sMjog Bog dsm sQl inhkyvlu Bvn kY ]291]
lines.transliteration_english: Trikoutee Ulanghi Soukh Saagar Sanjog Bhoga , Dasam Sadal Nihakayvalu Bhavan Kai ?291?

Shabad OS B.translation: By crossing the confluence of three nerves, one enjoys the bliss of meeting the Lord. The mystical door there is the unique place of enjoying peace, union, relishment and pleasure. (291)
